title: peace
comment: The state of harmony that is available to believers through having a right relationship with God and others and is especially associated with the presence of the Holy Spirit.

children.title: peace, human search for
children.comment: Scripture teaches that peace is only found in God, but people try to find it elsewhere. A person's desire for peace varies according to his or her circumstances.

children.title: The places where people search for peace
People search for peace in others
People search for peace in material possessions
People search for peace in God
The dangers in searching for peace
It can lead to suffering and bondage
People's search for peace varies according to their circumstances
The desire can increase in times of suffering and difficulties
The desire can diminish in times of comfort
peace, human destruction of
children.comment: Because of human sinfulness, God's provision of peace is always under threat. Scripture shows that this breaking of peace has implications for the whole of creation.

children.title: Causes of the destruction of peace
The consequences of the human destruction of peace
peace, divine in OT
children.comment: Providing peace for his creation is a characteristic of God. In the OT peace came through adherence to God's will as expressed in his spoken word, covenants and law. The Hebrew word ``shalom'' means ``peace in all its fulness, in every aspect of life''.

children.title: Through obedience to God's spoken word
Through provision of a holy city
Through provision of a house of God
peace, divine in NT
children.comment: God's ultimate provision of peace is discovered in the person and work of Jesus Christ. It is only through Christ that peace with God can be achieved and maintained.

children.title: Provision of peace through the Father
Peace in a believer's relationship with the Father
Peace through the Father's provision for the believer
Provision of peace through Jesus Christ
Provision of peace through the Holy Spirit
Through the Holy Spirit's inner witness
Peace as the Holy Spirit's fruit and gift
peace, believers' experience of
children.comment: Peace is the birthright of every believer in all circumstances. It is found only in God and is maintained through having a close relationship with him.

children.title: Peace for believers in differing situations
In times of sickness, pressure and hardships
In times of death and grief
The effects of peace for believers
Through living by the Holy Spirit
Final peace in death for believers
Hope of future peace for believers
